thread.title: Arsenal transfer news: Gunners given chance to hijack Everton’s move for Lyon winger Rachid Ghezzal
thread.title_full: Arsenal transfer news: Gunners given chance to hijack Everton’s move for Lyon winger Rachid Ghezzal

author: gboulton
title: Arsenal transfer news: Gunners given chance to hijack Everton’s move for Lyon winger Rachid Ghezzal
text:
Comments ARSENAL have been handed the chance to hijack Everton’s move for Lyon winger Rachid Ghezzal. 
The 24-year-old Algeria international is in the last few months of his contract at Lyon and is expected to leave as a free agent at the end of the season. Reuters Arsenal are set to make a surprise bid for Rachid Ghezzal 
Everton agreed a £12milion fee for Ghezzal last summer. 
Keep up-to-date with all the latest transfer news and gossip ahead of the January window with SunSport’s daily LIVE blog . 
But he rejected the move because he wanted to sign for a bigger club. 
Now the player’s representatives have been in touch with Arsenal to discuss a potential summer switch to the Emirates. AFP Ghezzal is currently representing Algeria at the African Cup of Nations Getty Images Arsene Wenger may hijack Everton’s attempts of landing the winger Related stories All the latest breaking news and gossip from the January transfer window off the mark Liverpool flop Lazar Markovic set to be sent back to Anfield from loan spell at Sporting Lisbon DONNA DEMANDS Prem clubs on red alert as agent Mino Raiola demands AC Milan pay £165,000-a-week for Gianluigi Donnarumma Jose wants Mour Antoine Griezmann, Bernardo Silva and Kieran Tierney: Jose Mourinho's top five Man United targets Andros Toonsend Palace winger Andros Townsend wants to return to Newcastle just six months after they sold him Serie-ous interest Juventus want Aguero to partner Dybala and Higuain in super attack if Sanchez bid fails mission impossible Carlos Tevez out to 'prove his worth' after arriving at Shanghai Shenhua on eye-watering deal You're staying Antoine Griezmann told he will be Atletico Madrid player 'for a long time' despite Man United's plan to raid 
It is a proposition which interests Arsene Wenger because there would be no transfer fee involved. 
Monaco are also showing an interest in Ghezzal but Everton see him as an ideal replacement for long-term injury victim Yannick Bolasie and are ready to offer him £100,000-a-week to move to Goodison. 
Lyon are still hoping to persuade Ghezzal to sign a new contract but have already prepared for his departure with the £17million signing of Memphis Depay from Manchester United this week. Mesut Ozil shows off his picture on the new Emirates Arsenal A380 plane
